H0.text: Lithosphere is the destination into which plant leaves release water from their tissues through tiny pores.

H1.text: Biosphere is the destination into which plant leavesâ€™ tiny pores help plants release water from their tissues.

H2.text: Hydrosphere is where plant leaves release water from their tissues through tiny pores.

H3.text: Atmosphere is where plant leaves release water from their tissues through tiny pores.

A4.text: Water vapour diffuses through the stomata into the atmosphere as part of a process called transpiration.
